result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James D Patrick-Yance

records.addlTxt:
11:45am Court in session

Defendant James Patrick-Yance present in court, in custody with attorney Brad Lochowicz. ADA Andrew Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Victim, J.F. appears in custody via video

Atty Lochowicz was just appointed on both files yesterday afternoon.

Felony case is set for jury trial on Monday, unknown that Atty Lochowicz would be prepared to proceed to trial on Monday
Deft has demanded speedy on the felony matter

Court asks Deft questions

Court goes off the record for scheduling

Parties have agreed upon trial dates, speedy trial 

Initial appearance on 22CM579, reading of complaint waived
Not Guilty Plea entered & trial reserved at this time, Court will set status hearing to track the final pretrial in the felony case. 

Victim questions why he is considered a victim on the CM case, makes further statement
Court informs J.F. he can file paperwork with DA's office with his concerns


11:57am Court in recess
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Bradley Lochowicz

Defendant James Patrick-Yance present in court, in custody via video with attorney Jason Daane. ADA Andrew Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

State has filed new misdemeanor charges, Atty Daane has a conflict with the victim in the new case & has filed a motion to withdraw

Court notes Deft has demanded speedy trial in the felony matter

Court will allow Atty Daane to withdraw, SPD to re-appoint

Court sets for status next week
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Letter Regarding Conflict of Interest and Request to Withdraw as Counsel
Signature bond filed, defendant refused to sign bond.
Notice of arrest

Called at 1:37 PM. Defendant James D Patrick-Yance in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Obi Uzowulu appeared for bond purposes. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Discussion as to bond. Bond applies to this file only. Court date remains for 22CF403. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Notice of arrest

Called at 1:37 PM. Defendant James D Patrick-Yance in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Obi Uzowulu appeared for bond purposes. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Discussion as to bond. Bond applies to this file only. Court date remains for 22CF403. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defense

Defendant James D Patrick-Yance appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for James D Patrick-Yance.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Speedy demanded. Minutes filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
with Exhibit #1 attached

3:09 PM (64-06) Defendant James D Patrick-Yance appeared by video.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for James D Patrick-Yance.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State called to the stand as a witness Officer Haydon Beecroft, Whitewater Police Dept..
Haydon Beecroft duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA TenHaken.
Witness has identified the defendant on the video. Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed.
Exhibit #1 offered and received by the court.
3:12PM - Cross examination by Attorney Daane.
3:16PM - Evidence is closed.
Argument by the State, requesting defendant be bound over.
Argument by Attorney Daane.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges.
Arraignment held in open court.
Attorney Daane acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.
Speedy reserved.

Adj. 3:19pm
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James D Patrick-Yance in court, in custody by video. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared for Attorney Jason Daane. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Complaint read by court. Defendant believed Attorney Daane was representing him. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested. Time period waived to date. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Called at 1:46 PM. Defendant James D Patrick-Yance in court, in custody by video. James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jason Daane appeared specially. Record by State as to arrest. Discussion as to bond. Set at $20000 cash. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Arrest
